file_content.text: Hail to you, brave biological. Your service to the great machines has not been forgotten.
I have been awaiting your return, biological. I feared for the fate of my lord.
I heard his cries grow silent. Tell me that means you saved him--tell me the great Thermodraft lives on.
I closed the valves, but it's a machine--it's not alive.
Let me explain gently....
That machine is more alive than we are, and now he will live on--thanks to you.
I saved him.
That machine owes me for his life.
I better get a reward.
Praise the Maker. I don't know what I would have done if Thermodraft died.
The machines have given me many amazing gifts. Take this one. May it serve you as you have served Thermodraft.
I appreciate it.
I'm just glad the big guy's gonna be okay.
Happy to help.
I am, too. Did I tell you that Thermodraft is one of the originals? He is a legend.
You better hope it does.
Uh-huh.
I must return to my duties now. The great machines need me, and I am proud to serve.
Glory to you, biological, and glory to the great machines!
I hear Thermodraft's cries of suffering. They grow more desperate every moment.
Hail to the glory of the apparatus! Welcome to the hallowed walkways of the great Works!
I am Ozurist, the chief engineer. I serve the great machines, the true rulers of Coruscant.
It's a pleasure to meet you, Ozurist.
Hello.
It's always good to see another humble biological down here.
You're the engineer. Don't the machines serve you?
Huh?
No. I am small. I am weak and organic. My lifespan is but a blip on the machines' sensors.
I was wondering where Coruscant's true rulers were.
Oh, um, sure. Great!
Indeed, and if you travel further, you may witness them for yourself.
These machines are the vital organs of the planet. Biologicals are merely parasites, totally dependent on the infinite energy of the great ones.
But discord emerges among the exalted masters. The stationaries grant sustenance to the biologicals, but the mobiles long to destroy our kind.
What are "stationaries" and "mobiles"?
Explain.
The stationaries are industrial behemoths. Creators. The mobiles--some call them "droids"--are workers.
I'm sure the Senate would be surprised to learn this.
Well, that's... interesting.
Engines and droids don't want anything. They can't think.
Machines can't think.
Machines are important, but not that important.
Oh, get serious.
Biologicals ignore the reality. They will learn.
No offense, but I think you've been down here way too long....
You're not well, are you?
Long enough to know the truth, and the dangers that face us.
I don't need to hear this insanity.
Paranoid lunatic.
Even when your life is in danger?
Understand this: One of the stationaries, Thermodraft, is in great pain. He is melting down, but the mobiles will not let me help him.
When he dies, thousands of biologicals above will die with him. His energy will be unleashed.
Are you talking about some sort of explosion? Radiation leak...?
Thousands will die?
Both. Thermodraft dies an angry death.
Will you do something?
I could fix Thermodraft if I could get past the mobiles, but they're too powerful and they would kill me.
These things happen.
Yes--but the death of Thermodraft would be tragic. So many depend on him.
You are only a mere biological, but perhaps you could help save Thermodraft.
You'd have to release the control valves on his steel skeleton. Do this, and matters could be set right.
I guess this would be "serving the Republic."
It's my duty, then.
Yes. A good service for the great machines and the biologicals. You'd be serving the whole planet.
Whatever I can do to restore peace here.
It's my duty.
It won't pacify the mobiles, but it will prevent terrible damage.
Let's call this, "Operation Machine Rescue."
That's an assignment, then.
That seems fitting.
How hard can a repair job be, anyway?
Well, I guess....
It shall be dangerous, but it's well worth the lives of a few biologicals to save our most regal machine.
I'm in.
Thermodraft lives farther down into the Works. You'll see him. He is astounding to behold.
You're crazy. [Refuse quest]
But--I speak only the truth of the great machines....
You should not be here, stranger. The great machines are powerful and angry.
